title: Hector Fajardo
text:
Hi there! üëã
I‚Äôm an agricultural engineer and agronomist with a passion for keeping nutrients where they belong ‚Äî in the soil, not the water.
I‚Äôm currently pursuing my PhD at North Carolina State University (Go Pack! üê∫üêæ) in Biological and Agricultural Engineering, where I spend my days thinking about phosphorus, modeling watersheds, and explaining to my computer why it should cooperate.
Also, I‚Äôm proud to be both a STEPS Scholar and a FFAR Fellow, which basically means I get to work with some brilliant people while trying to save the world one nutrient cycle at a time.
Before landing in Raleigh, NC, I earned my Master‚Äôs in Soil Fertility from Louisiana State University (Geaux Tigers! üêÖ) and my Bachelor‚Äôs in Agricultural Engineering from Universidad Mayor de San Andr√©s in Bolivia ‚õ∞Ô∏èüáßüá¥.
In short ‚Äî I love soil, sustainability, and simulations. If it involves plants, water, or code, there‚Äôs a good chance I‚Äôm interested.

title: Welcome
text:
Portrait of Hector Fajardo


Hello! I‚Äôm Hector Fajardo, a researcher and science communicator passionate about understanding the world through data and sharing those insights widely. On this site you‚Äôll find highlights from my research projects, science communication work, and writing. Take a look around to learn more about the stories I‚Äôm exploring and the communities I‚Äôm collaborating with.
Whether you‚Äôre interested in collaborating, learning more about my work, or just saying hello, feel free to reach out. I‚Äôm always excited to connect and discuss new ideas.

title: Research and professional experience
text:
BS: Agricultural Engineering (Universidad Mayor de San Andres - Bolivia) Crop modeling on nitrogen fertilization and irrigation scheduling
Irrigation systems management consultant
MSc:Soil Science ‚Äì Soil Fertility (Louisiana State University) Sensor based (UAV and Proximal sensor) cover crop nutrient content Cover cropping effect on sugarcane productivity and nutrient cycling
PhD: BAE (NC State ‚Äì STEPS) Process-based modeling and stable isotopic source tracking for phosphate source attribution in an agricultural watershed
